title: Research Labs and Centers
text: AHS has a track record of funding from a variety of federal and state agencies and foundations. Consistently ranked among the top 10 colleges of allied health in research funding, the college’s research emphasis is the intersection of health, disability and rehabilitation.

Helping vocational research agencies increase their capacity to help and the quality of services for Chicago-based Asian Americans with disabilities through culturally and linguistically appropriate outreach

We study gait biomechanics in hip osteoarthritis with the twin goals of understanding the mechanistic role of gait (dys)function in hip osteoarthritis, and improving outcomes in multiple domains, like gait, physical activity, clinical outcomes, and quality of life.
Testing and developing low-cost, clinically-translatable therapies that enhance brain plasticity to optimize movement recovery
Promoting empowerment of minority individuals with disabilities and capacity building among agencies delivering services to minority populations
Providing the knowledge and skills necessary for promoting independence, equal opportunity, quality of life and longevity for people with disabilities
Developing and providing comprehensive entrepreneurship education and training programs for people with disabilities and service providers
Promoting positive outcomes for young children and their families by working in the areas of community service, research and professional development
Advancing client-centered care and outcomes in pediatric rehabilitation by harnessing technology to build innovative tools
Examining the effects of various cognitive and motor therapies for improving impairment, function, and participation in older and neurologically impaired populations
Facilitating the public policy debate, legislative activity and advocacy efforts in the disability field through the dissemination of research
Researching how to reduce health disparities for racial and ethnic minorities, rural residents, women, children, the elderly and people with disabilities
Concentrating on health-related research across several disciplines using translational cardiovascular approaches
Generating knowledge about the needs and experiences of families who provide support to children and adults with disabilities across the life course
Our goals are to improve access to healthcare, increase adherence, empower patients, and assist healthcare professionals to care for their patients.
A safe and engaging community for kids and parents to learn to live life as healthy and happy as possible
Integrating cardiovascular function, metabolism, inflammation, hydration, nutrition status and exercise/physical activity
Defining how a client and therapist each contribute to the unique interpersonal dynamic that becomes the therapeutic relationship
Studying rehabilitation while providing training in motor control, biomedical engineering and motor rehabilitation
Investigating why people fall (and why they don’t) with the goal of remediating balance impairment
Home to the most widely-cited and utilized occupation-focused practice model in the world
Improving vocational rehabilitation and employment options for refugees with disabilities in Illinois and elsewhere
